programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: The animal kingdom can be cold and unforgiving, but for baby baboons, penguins, capybaras, and emperor tamarins, having a helpful family makes life a little easier.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Head to the heart of Central Kalimantan, Borneo-home to one of the most unique schools in the world. There are 68 students in all, including class clown Valentino (who loves a short-cut) and class couple Darril and Liti (who have their first fight).

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Best buds Valentino, Madara and Utris are ready for the next stage of forest school. Baby Clarita is at long last reunited with her mother. And toddler Mema discovers a tasty treat inside a rotten log (it can happen!).

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Even orangutans have to watch what they eat. Find out if Beni can stick to a leafy green diet (and stop stealing food). See what kind of tasty treats Lanting can find while skipping class. And watch as Rebecca prepares to return to a truly wild life.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: There’s watery fun with group two as they visit group three’s flooded classroom. Ayu, Ruthie, and Kesi take a step closer to release. And the arrival of Alba-the world’s rarest orangutan-creates a sensation at Orangutan Jungle School.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Now that albino orangutan Alba’s here, how will her classmates react? Plus, take a tour of the nursery school, see how Beni deals with a big bully, and watch as a few feisty females find their place in a new hierarchy.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Enter Brazil’s Serra da Capivara at the beginning of the dry season as a troop of capuchin monkeys welcomes its newest member. Explore the forest alongside the curious baby, who faces threats from predators, food shortages, and even the wild climate.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Explore the verdant rainforest of the Western Ghats in southern India, where an endangered baby lion-tailed macaque will need to learn the laws of the jungle to survive food shortages, a shrinking habitat, and hungry predators.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The food chain of Africa’s savannah is a complex web of wildlife that entangles landscape-altering elephants, vast herds of antelope, apex predators, and a range of other species that have evolved to survive in this diverse and brutal landscape.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Follow a day in the life of a gregarious meerkat family in the mighty Kalahari Desert of South Africa. Led by a dominant female, the family must find food, tutor pups, and avoid predators in a scorched land where only the toughest survive.

programme.title: Wild Birds Of Australia
programme.desc: Get to know Australia’s fiercest birds of prey. Find out how highly specialized killers like falcons, eagles, ospreys, and owls use special senses and traits to survive.

programme.title: Wild Birds Of Australia
programme.desc: Meet four bird species that go to exceptional lengths to find mates and raise their young. See how they protect their territory from invaders, attract the ideal mate, and safeguard their chicks to give them the best chance at life.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: As food and water become scarce, Crystal, the fierce leader of the Ruins gang, sets her sights on rival Kati’s territory and its neighbouring fruit trees. Watch as Crystal’s move and a raid by outside invaders lead to dire consequences for one troop.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: The drought is finally over, but traversing the forest for food is still a gamble. See some leaders take the risk, leaving home territories undefended to feast on a cicada boom. When they return, trespassers are ready for a fight.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The food chain of Africa’s savannah is a complex web of wildlife that entangles landscape-altering elephants, vast herds of antelope, apex predators, and a range of other species that have evolved to survive in this diverse and brutal landscape.

programme.desc: Meet four bird species that go to exceptional lengths to find mates and raise their young. See how they protect their territory from invaders, attract the ideal mate, and safeguard their chicks to give them the best chance at life.

programme.title: Secret Life Of The Tasmanian Devil
programme.desc: For Tasmanian devils, dominance is the name of the game during mating season. Meet males who fight for the right to pass on their genes, and learn about the violent, noisy etiquette of these carnivorous marsupials’ mealtime.

programme.title: Secret Life Of The Tasmanian Devil
programme.desc: Tasmanian Devils might have the most infamous reputations of any of the country’s marsupials, but these spirited scrappers also have another side. They’re committed parents and heroic defenders of their pouch-reared young.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: In the cool highlands near Australia’s Snowy Mountains is Wombat Wood. There, dotted amongst the trees and dense foliage, are over a hundred wombat burrows. But when some of the burrows are flooded, the wombats need to find safety.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Enter Brazil’s Serra da Capivara at the beginning of the dry season as a troop of capuchin monkeys welcomes its newest member. Explore the forest alongside the curious baby, who faces threats from predators, food shortages, and even the wild climate.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Explore the verdant rainforest of the Western Ghats in southern India, where an endangered baby lion-tailed macaque will need to learn the laws of the jungle to survive food shortages, a shrinking habitat, and hungry predators.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The food chain of Africa’s savannah is a complex web of wildlife that entangles landscape-altering elephants, vast herds of antelope, apex predators, and a range of other species that have evolved to survive in this diverse and brutal landscape.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Follow a day in the life of a gregarious meerkat family in the mighty Kalahari Desert of South Africa. Led by a dominant female, the family must find food, tutor pups, and avoid predators in a scorched land where only the toughest survive.

programme.title: Wild Birds Of Australia
programme.desc: Get to know Australia’s fiercest birds of prey. Find out how highly specialized killers like falcons, eagles, ospreys, and owls use special senses and traits to survive.

programme.title: Wild Birds Of Australia
programme.desc: Meet four bird species that go to exceptional lengths to find mates and raise their young. See how they protect their territory from invaders, attract the ideal mate, and safeguard their chicks to give them the best chance at life.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Follow the staff at Parc Omega in Quebec, Canada, during the busy spring when moose, boars, raccoons, and visiting Canada Geese have their babies.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Beni faces his weigh-in while Alba is back in isolation. Pujon reclaims his position as gang leader. A team heads out to rescue an infant orangutan. And an unwelcome visitor prompts the staff to introduce a cautionary lesson in snake awareness.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Rescued orphan Josh needs his broken wrist examined, and Beni visits the dentist to treat his bad breath. Having overcome her typhoid infection, Alba is reunited with her old friends, but receives a frosty reception.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: It’s a first at forest school. Inside the clinic, the team meets a mysterious new creature. It turns out to be a sun bear-the tiniest of all bears! Find out how Denny Bear fares in these new surroundings.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Clara and baby Clarita are strong enough to move to Bangamat Island, but are met with a hostile reception. Kasper is ready to be released in the wild. And instant celebrity Taymur tries to make a new friend.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: These orangutans have come a long way! Six jungle school graduates are finally set free, ready to start a new life in a National Park. Back at basecamp, clumsy climber Malika tries to keep up with her class, and Beni’s strict diet is hard to handle.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Ants, rats, and bats are uninvited guests. These animals use sheer numbers to claim a territory, and some are even considered pests. But their very survival may depend on finding a home where they’re not welcome.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: For many species, strength in numbers and protecting the empire are imperative to survival. For these animals, protection means isolation and finding sanctuary from threats outside their boundaries.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Epic flights, adventurous sea journeys, and exhausting road trips all play a key part in the lives of many species. But booking and organizing travel is no easy feat when those plans involve hundreds-even thousands-of individuals.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Venture into the heart of Namibia, where parts of the landscape receive less than an inch of rain each year. Find incredibly resilient creatures from the largest mammals to the fastest insects and a ghost-like fish found nowhere else in the world.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: Explore a corner of Namibia dominated by stifling heat and parched sand. But the margins of Etosha National Park are dotted with oases that attract herds of thirsty creatures, antelopes, exotic birds, plus the world's biggest elephants.

programme.title: Extreme Africa
programme.desc: The 1,200 mile Orange River is the longest in South Africa. Follow its westward journey, and see a diverse sample of wildlife from powerful swimming birds like the African darter, to flat lizards who inhabit the granite rocks of the Augrabies Falls.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: As the babies grow, new power struggles break out in each troop. Watch as every member, from fierce Queen Crystal to low-ranking Erica, jockeys for position. Meanwhile, the babies start to understand how allies and enemies will shape their future.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: The pressure to find food reaches new heights and throws the reserve into turmoil. Witness fractures emerge within the ranks, dividing the gangs and leading Crystal, the indomitable leader of the Ruins gang, to face a challenge like none before.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: The mix of old and new growth forests in the Rockies creates a balance that allows each species to thrive. Learn how both Mother Nature and humans are protecting this essential mix of forests, even if that means destroying them once in a while.

programme.title: Wild Rockies
programme.desc: Group living is integral to many of the animals living in the Rockies. Although no two species organise their society in the same way, explore how various mountain creatures work together to gain greater access to food, mates, and protection.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: Wombats are solitary, slow-moving creatures, but breeding time brings out their energy, aggression and lots of play. Meet a southern hairy-nosed wombat named Birri, who’s trying to find a mate, along with a female named Winnie and her joey, Fred.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted bull sharks deep in Cozumel's underwater reefs. Watch as these huge sharks swim and interact with the other inhabitants of these coral reefs.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Enjoy the spring baby boom at the centre as the staff go gaga over an adorable bundle of baby possums. Then see the rescue team hit a rooftop patio for a little R and R: retrieving and rescuing a mama and her ducklings perched high above the city.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: See staff care for baby bunnies injured in a dog attack and then join the centre's release team as they introduce an abandoned cygnet to an adoptive mother swan, and find that things don't go exactly as planned.

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: Millions of years ago, castaway creatures were stranded on the rugged shores of Madagascar. Left to evolve on their own, they've found a way to perfectly adapt to their tropical climate. Now, see what life is like for a family of ring-tailed lemurs.
